channel.title: BBC Sport

item.title: Blackburn to Barcelona - Dolan's 'unbelievable' journey to Espanyol
item.description: Five years ago, Tyrhys Dolan was playing for Clitheroe - now he is preparing to face Barcelona in the Catalan derby.

item.title: 'Nancy leaps to his own defence as he feels Old Firm heat'
item.description: Just over four weeks on from his appointment as Celtic manager, Wilfried Nancy's passionate defence of his reign shows the pressure he is facing before Saturday's Old Firm derby against Rangers.

item.title: 'Good idea' or taking 'massive chance' - is Rosenior ready for Chelsea?
item.description: Liam Rosenior is the leading candidate to become the Chelsea manager. BBC Sport looks at the reasons why.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Newcastle fan Andrew Cushin
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter & Newcastle fan Andrew Cushin - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Villa 'not convinced' to sign Elliott permanently - Emery
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery says the club were "not convinced" two months ago to sign Harvey Elliott permanently.

item.title: West Ham sign Brazilian forward Pablo Felipe
item.description: West Ham complete the signing of Brazilian striker Pablo Felipe from Portuguese club Gil Vicente on a four-and-a-half-year deal.

item.title: Salah goals & Hakimi's return - six Afcon group stage talking points
item.description: BBC Sport Africa takes a look back at some of the key talking points from the 2025 Africa Cup of Nations group stage.

item.title: 'I needed them and they were there' - when young players find new homes
item.description: BBC Sport explores how young footballers build bonds with second families when they leave home to sign for a new club on their path to the top.

item.title: Spurs season hard to 'enjoy' for Frank as he shares fans' frustration
item.description: Thomas Frank says he understands and shares the frustration of Tottenham fans after he was booed following Thursday's Premier League draw at Brentford.

item.title: 'Never did I think one day I'd be playing in Spain'
item.description: Espanyol winger Tyrhys Dolan speaks to Elizabeth Conway about his journey from non-league football to La Liga.

item.title: 'I will leave one day' - Guardiola on Man City future
item.description: Manchester City head coach Pep Guardiola has insisted he wants to "fight with his team" and see out his contract at the club, following reported interest in former Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca.

item.title: 'Defending Haaland with no fear' - how Sunderland stopped Man City
item.description: MOTD pundits Steph Houghton and Dion Dublin analyse how Sunderland's defence repelled Erling Haaland and his Man City team-mates to earn a goalless draw at the Stadium of Light.

item.title: Why Maresca's tenure at Chelsea turned sour
item.description: BBC Sport reporter Nizaar Kinsella explains how Enzo Maresca's position as Chelsea's manager became "untenable".

item.title: Romero fortunate to avoid 'easy' red card - Andrews
item.description: Brentford manager Keith Andrews takes issue with the decision not to award a foul or show a red card for the potential denial of a goalscoring opportunity for Cristian Romero's challenge on Igor Thiago in a 0-0 draw with Spurs.

item.title: Cold snap hits weekend EFL & National League games
item.description: Five of Sunday's League Two matches along with six in the National League on Saturday postponed due to frozen pitches.

item.title: Johnson 'excited to join Palace journey' after £35m move
item.description: Brennan Johnson is set to be included in Crystal Palace's squad to face Newcastle on Sunday after his club-record £35m move from Tottenham was finalised on Friday.

item.title: Wales hope 'genius' Bellamy stays amid club interest
item.description: Wales head coach Craig Bellamy is attracting interest from clubs - but FAW boss Noel Mooney hopes he will stay until Euro 2028.

item.title: Rodrygo wants Real Madrid exit - Saturday's gossip
item.description: Rodrygo is wanted by a trio of Premier League clubs as he looks to leave Real Madrid, Manchester United have reignited interest in Carlos Baleba, while West Ham are chasing Taty Castellanos.

item.title: Gross rejoins Brighton until June 2027
item.description: Midfielder Pascal Gross returns to Brighton from Borussia Dortmund on a deal until June 2027.

item.title: 11 EFL players who could be on the move in January
item.description: BBC Sport examines some of the leading talent in the EFL likely to be subject to interest and offers over the January transfer window.

item.title: 'I need time... it's normal you guys kill me' - Nancy's plea before Old Firm test
item.description: Wilfried Nancy launches a passionate defence of his methods and stresses the need for time if he is to succeed at Celtic.

item.title: 'Whirlwind' 24 hours - McFarlane ready for Chelsea chance
item.description: Chelsea interim manager Calum McFarlane says it has been a "crazy" 24 hours since replacing Enzo Maresca at Stamford Bridge.

item.title: Liverpool agree deal for midfielder Bergstrom
item.description: Liverpool agree a deal with Swedish side BK Hacken for midfielder Alice Bergstrom for an undisclosed fee.

item.title: London City appoint Maestre as manager
item.description: Women's Super League side London City Lionesses have appointed Eder Maestre as manager following the sacking of Jocelyn Precheur.

item.title: AC Milan sign West Ham striker Fullkrug on loan
item.description: West Ham striker Niclas Fullkrug joins Italian side AC Milan on loan for the remainder of the season, with the option to make the move permanent.

item.title: 'Best bargain' Kamara at heart of Aston Villa success
item.description: Boubacar Kamara is Aston Villa's unassuming star and has quietly evolved into one of the best midfielders in the Premier League.

item.title: Man City held by stubborn Sunderland in entertaining draw
item.description: Manchester City fall four points behind Arsenal in the Premier League title race after being held to a goalless draw by Sunderland, who maintain their unbeaten home record.

item.title: Leeds hold Liverpool to goalless draw at Anfield
item.description: Liverpool draw 0-0 with Leeds to start 2026 with their first goalless draw of Arne Slot's tenure at Anfield.

item.title: Cairney scores stunning late equaliser for Fulham at Palace
item.description: Tom Cairney scores late to earn Fulham a 1-1 draw and extend Crystal Palace's winless run across competitions.

item.title: Spurs draw on Frank's return to Brentford
item.description: Spurs are unable to produce a win at manager Thomas Frank's former club as they draw 0-0 against Brentford.

item.title: Ayr one of six SPFL games off because of snow & ice
item.description: Five of this weekend's SPFL matches have been postponed because of freezing weather across Scotland with further pitch inspections to follow on Saturday.

item.title: How is Premier League doing in race for five Champions League places?
item.description: With the top three in the Premier League pulling away, could fifth be enough for Champions League football again?

item.title: Celtic sign Bournemouth's Araujo on loan
item.description: Celtic sign Bournemouth right-back Julian Araujo on loan for the rest of the season, making him Wilfried Nancy's first recruit.

item.title: Keeper Forster joins Bournemouth on six-month deal
item.description: Bournemouth sign former Tottenham and Celtic goalkeeper Fraser Forster on a six-month deal.

item.title: Rangers 'working 24/7' on signings, says boss Rohl
item.description: Rangers are working around the clock to recruit players in the January transfer window, says head coach Danny Rohl.

item.title: Should Romero have been sent off against Brentford?
item.description: Should Tottenham's Cristian Romero have been sent off for bringing down Brentford's Igor Thiago when the striker was through on goal?

item.title: Larne beat title rivals Coleraine to go seven clear
item.description: Larne extend their lead at the top of the Irish Premiership to seven points after a comprehensive 3-0 win over second-placed Coleraine.

item.title: How Farke's 'rock solid' Leeds turned the corner
item.description: Match of the Day Pundit Steph Houghton discusses Leeds United's performance against Liverpool and their recent development under Daniel Farke.

item.title: 'It's a tough place to come' - Guardiola on Sunderland draw
item.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola praises Sunderland's performance after his team was held to a goalless at the Stadium of Light.

item.title: Ovation on Brentford return 'special' - Frank
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur manager Thomas Frank spoke on his joy at being welcomed back by the crowd at Bournemouth, where he spent nine years coaching.

item.title: 'Our standards are high' - Le Bris proud after Man City draw
item.description: Sunderland manager Regis Le Bris discusses his team's high standards as they extend their unbeaten home record at the Stadium of Light after a 0-0 draw against Manchester City.

item.title: Leeds deserved 'hard-fought' point against Liverpool - Farke
item.description: Leeds United manager Daniel Farke says he is proud of his side's "hard-fought" clean sheet at Anfield, after they were "rock solid" against Liverpool.

item.title: 'Heavy metal? It's not even aluminium foil football'
item.description: As Liverpool are booed off following a goalless draw against Leeds, it was hardly the start to the New Year that Arne Slot's side would have wanted.

item.title: 'We are not happy' - Man City fall behind Arsenal in title race
item.description: Pep Guardiola questioned whether it was only a two-horse Premier League title race, but his Manchester City side can ill-afford many slip-ups in their quest to hunt down leaders Arsenal.

item.title: Government suspends Gabon team, bans Aubameyang and sacks coach
item.description: Gabon's sports minister announces a series of punishments after the national team's "disgraceful performance" at the Africa Cup of Nations.

item.title: Rosenior leading contender for Chelsea job
item.description: Strasbourg boss Liam Rosenior is the leading contender to be the next Chelsea manager, but others remain under consideration.

item.title: What went wrong between Chelsea and Maresca?
item.description: Less than six months after guiding Chelsea to Club World Cup success, Enzo Maresca has left. But how did things unravel?

item.title: Brazil legend Roberto Carlos recovering in hospital
item.description: Brazil and Real Madrid legend Roberto Carlos is "recovering well" after undergoing what he describes as "a preventative medical procedure".

item.title: Silva calls for review of head injury treatment rules
item.description: Fulham manager Marco Silva wants a review of the rules on head injury treatment after Jorge Cuenca is off the pitch during Crystal Palace's goal.

item.title: Liverpool needed more pace to break through difficult Leeds defence - Slot
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says his side needed more pace to break through and create chances against Leeds United's low block, following their goalless draw at Anfield.

item.title: Palace in 'survival mode' as winless run continues
item.description: Crystal Palace manager Oliver Glasner says his thin squad are in "survival mode" after his tired squad hung on to a 1-1 draw against Fulham in the Premier League.

item.title: Silva praises 'top level' Cainey performance
item.description: Fulham manager Marco Silva praises midfielder Tom Cairney after his second-half equaliser earned them a 1-1 draw against Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

item.title: 'That is divine!' - watch every PL goal of the month winner from 2025
item.description: Watch every winner from Match of the Day's goal of the month votes in 2025, and a selection of December's best Premier League goals.

item.title: Gabriel & Saliba dominate as Arsenal make 'big statement'
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Danny Murphy analyses how Gabriel Magalhaes and William Saliba dominated in defence for Arsenal in their 4-1 victory over Aston Villa.

item.title: Who is one card away from suspension in the Premier League?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at who is currently nearing a suspension in the Premier League.

item.title: Eight men's footballers hoping for a big 2026
item.description: BBC Sport looks at some of the players hoping for a big 2026 for various reasons.

item.title: Who might be on move in January in WSL?
item.description: With the January transfer window opening in the Women's Super League, which players could be on the move and who is out of contract?

item.title: How football star's transfer sparked Korean saying
item.description: Alan Smith's transfer from Elland Road to Old Trafford sparked a phrase which lives on in Korea.

item.title: Why is the Dundee derby not part of the 3pm blackout?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at why the Dundee derby is being shown on TV despite the 3pm blackout.

item.title: McFarlane to take on Guardiola - but who is he?
item.description: Chelsea Under-21 head coach Calum McFarlane is set to take charge of the Premier League trip to Manchester City.

item.title: Set-pieces 'becoming a problem' for Chelsea
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Rob Green discuss where Chelsea fell short in defending set pieces in their 2-2 draw with Bournemouth.

item.title: 'Top midfield play' - Garner shines for Everton at Forest
item.description: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Rob Green discuss how James Garner influenced Everton's 2-0 win at Nottingham Forest.

item.title: 'Definitely not' Semenyo's last game for Bournemouth - Iraola
item.description: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola reflects on his team's 2-2 draw against Chelsea and discusses speculation that forward Antoine Semenyo is set to leave the club in January.

item.title: 'This year has been crazy' - Caballero
item.description: Assistant coach Willy Caballero steps in for Enzo Maresca to discuss Chelsea's 2-2 performance against Bournemouth at at Stamford Bridge and says "this year has been crazy" for the Blues.

item.title: Man Utd lacked imagination in 'strange' game - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says his side lacked imagination during their "strange" 1-1 draw with bottom side Wolves at Old Trafford.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this week
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: How does Maresca's Chelsea record compare?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explore Enzo Maresca's records as Chelsea manager and how it compared to previous bosses.

item.title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
item.description: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

item.title: Take on our BBC Gameshows ultimate football quiz
item.description: We've built five quizzes to celebrate five BBC shows - but only those with the biggest football trivia brains can beat them all.

item.title: EFL Quiz of the Year: Who has been breaking records in 2025?
item.description: From record-breakers to dire financial situations, there's been much to talk about in the English Football League in 2025 - but do you remember the finer details?

item.title: 'Just reach out' - Man Utd's Bennett on his father's suicide
item.description: Manchester United defender Rhys Bennett discusses his father's death in October to help raise awareness of mental health issues.

item.title: Transfers - January 2026
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Who is Bendito Mantato? Man Utd debutant profiled
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at Manchester United teenager Bendito Mantato, who made his senior debut against Wolves in United's final match of 2025

item.title: 'It's a mystery' - why Premier League teams haven't played every club yet
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why Premier League teams have not played every opponent yet despite being at the midway point in the season.

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: 'McCann considered for Kilmarnock job' - gossip
item.description: Neil McCann is reportedly among the candidates being considered to be Kilmarnock manager, while Celtic are linked with Uruguay's Nacho Laquintana and Rangers are said to still want James Penrice and Josh Windass.

item.title: Murray appointed as new Morton manager
item.description: Greenock Morton appoint Ian Murray as their new manager, with the former Scotland defender signing an 18-month contract.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Wilkinson hoping Fishlock will join Wales staff
item.description: Rhian Wilkinson hopes Jess Fishlock will join Wales' staff for the start of World Cup qualifying in March.

item.title: Wiegman gets honorary damehood in New Year Honours
item.description: Ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean become a dame and knight in the New Year Honours list, while England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is made an honorary dame.

item.title: Tottenham sign Sweden defender Wijk
item.description: Tottenham Hotspur confirm the signing of BK Hacken defender Hannah Wijk on a long-term contract, subject to international clearance and work permit.

item.title: Man Utd sign Germany international Schuller
item.description: Manchester United have signed Germany international Lea Schuller from Bayern Munich until June 2029.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
